meanings.definition: A small, two-wheeled carriage pulled by a person.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used jinrikishas to travel short distances.
meanings.sent2: Tourists in Japan often enjoy riding jinrikishas to explore the city.
meanings.sent3: The jinrikishas in the race were so fast, they almost beat the bicycles!
meanings.sent4: The jinrikishas lined up in a row, resembling a colorful parade.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the jinrikishas' wheels on the cobblestone road was rhythmic and soothing.

meanings.definition: A type of transportation in Japan.
meanings.sent1: During my trip to Japan, I rode in a jinrikishas to visit the temples.
meanings.sent2: Locals use jinrikishas to navigate through the bustling streets of Tokyo.
meanings.sent3: The jinrikishas in Tokyo have unique designs, making them stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The jinrikishas glided through the city like graceful swans on water.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations on the jinrikishas added a festive touch to the streets of Kyoto.

meanings.definition: A traditional mode of transportation in Asia.
meanings.sent1: In some Asian countries, jinrikishas are still used as a primary means of transport.
meanings.sent2: The history of jinrikishas dates back centuries in various Asian cultures.
meanings.sent3: The jinrikishas in the old town were like time machines, taking you back in history.
meanings.sent4: The jinrikishas weaved through the narrow streets, carrying passengers with ease.
meanings.sent5: The sight of jinrikishas lined up along the street painted a vivid picture of traditional Asian life.
